meanings.definition: To subject to the action of the sun.
meanings.sent1: She is solarizing her garden to help the plants grow.
meanings.sent2: The photographer is solarizing the film to create a unique effect.
meanings.sent3: The sun seems to be solarizing everything in its path today.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like a solarizing beam of light in the room.
meanings.sent5: The process of solarizing the fabric made it brighter and more vibrant.

meanings.definition: To treat with sunlight or ultraviolet light in photography to produce a negative image.
meanings.sent1: The artist is solarizing the photograph to achieve a vintage look.
meanings.sent2: Photographers often use the technique of solarizing for artistic effects.
meanings.sent3: The camera mistakenly solarized the picture, creating a surreal effect.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like solarizing a black-and-white world into color.
meanings.sent5: The solarizing process added a dreamy quality to the image.

meanings.definition: To become affected by the sun's rays.
meanings.sent1: The delicate flowers are solarizing beautifully under the sun.
meanings.sent2: After hours in the sun, her skin started solarizing and turning red.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream was left out too long and began solarizing in the heat.
meanings.sent4: His mood always solarizes when he spends time outdoors.
meanings.sent5: The solarizing effect of the sun made the landscape look magical.
